ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Which of these statements best describes the food eaten in your household: "enough of the kinds of food (I/we) want to eat; -enough, but not always the kinds of food (I/we) want; -sometimes not enough to eat; or, -often not enough to eat?
Notes: 1= Enough of the kinds of food we want to eat; 2= Enough but not always the kinds of food we want; 3= Sometimes not enough to eat; 4= Often not enough to eat

ElementDescription: The first statement is "(I/We) worried whether (my/our) food would run out before (I/we) got money to buy more."
Notes: 2= Often true; 1= Sometimes true; 0= Never true

ElementDescription: Did you worry that food at home would run out before your family got money to buy more?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= A lot; 999= Not Answered

ElementDescription: How often were you not able to eat a balanced meal because your family didn't have enough money?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= A lot; 999= Not Answered

ElementDescription: Has the size of you meals been cut because your family didn't have enough money for food?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= A lot; 999= Not Answered

ElementDescription: If you answered yes (MealCut), how often did this happen?
Notes: 0=Only 1 or 2 months; 1=Some months but not every month; 2=Almost every month

ElementDescription: Did you have to eat less because your family didn't have enough money to buy food?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= A lot; 999= Not Answered

ElementDescription: Did you have to skip a meal because your family didn't have enough food?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= A lot; 999= Not Answered

ElementDescription: Did you lose weight because there wasn't enough money for food?
Did (you/you or other adults in your household) ever not eat for a whole day because there wasn't enough money for food?
[IF YES ABOVE, ASK] How often did this happen? almost every (month/ day), some (month/ day)s but not every (month/ day), or in only 1 or 2 (months/ days)?
Notes: 2= Almost every (month/ day); 1= Some (months/ day) but not every (month/ day); 0= Only 1 or 2 (months/ days)

ElementDescription: "(I/we) relied on only a few kinds of low-cost food to feed (my/our) child/the children) because (I was/we were) running out of money to buy food."
Notes: 2= Often true; 1= Sometimes true; 0= Never true

ElementDescription: "(I/We) couldn't feed (my/our) child/the children) a balanced meal, because (I/we) couldn't afford that."
Notes: 2= Often true; 1= Sometimes true; 0= Never true

ElementDescription: "(My/Our child was/The children were) not eating enough because (I/we) just couldn't afford enough food."
Notes: 2= Often true; 1= Sometimes true; 0= Never true

ElementDescription: Did you cut the size of (your child's/any of the children's) meals because there wasn't enough money for food?
Did (CHILD'S NAME/any of the children) skip meals because there wasn't enough money for food?
[IF YES ABOVE ASK] How often did this happen? almost every (month/ day), some (months/ days) but not every (month/ day), or in only 1 or 2 (months/ days)?
Notes: 2= Almost every (month/ day); 1= Some (months/ day) but not every (month/ day); 0= Only 1 or 2 (months/ days)

ElementDescription: (was your child/were the children) hungry but you just couldn't afford more food?
Did (your child/any of the children) not eat for a whole day because there wasn't enough money for food?

U.S. Adult Food Security Scale
